title: Dream Big, Work Hard, Stay Humble.
subtitle: ——Be Versatile, Be Great.
about_text1: Hello! My name is Zhe Xu, but you can also call me Joshua. I am currently a second-year Master's student at the School of Computer Science, Fudan University, supervised by Prof. Xipeng Qiu. My research interests focus on embodied intelligence and speech models, and I am currently exploring full-duplex speech interaction. Previously, I obtained my Bachelor's degree from Fudan University, where from freshman to sophomore year I conducted computer vision research under the supervision of Prof. Lifeng Chen under the guidance of Prof. Xiangyang Xue. In my junior year, I completed two six-month NLP internships at the Nuclear Power Institute of China, Institute No. 8 and NetEase Leihuo, and then joined the Fudan NLP Lab (FNLP) to pursue NLP research. During my first year of graduate studies, I co-founded the Fudan University RM Team EGA and served as the leader of the Vision Group, responsible for implementing the auto-aiming system.
about_text2: Personally, I am dedicated to addressing truly meaningful research problems, and I tend to focus on work that aligns with first principles. The most fundamental issues I currently believe in are Scaling and Search. Feel free to contact me anytime if you share the same passion for these problems.
